intro: Mesynium rigidum, commonly known as the rigid mesynium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are rigid and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
